New Records: Lisandro Martinez became the first Argentina defender to score at Copa America since Victor Cuesta in 2016.
Key Match Events: Lionel Messi missed a penalty in the shootout.
Emi Martinez made two crucial saves in the penalty shootout.
Nicolas Otamendi scored the decisive penalty to secure Argentina's victory.
Lisandro Martinez scored the opening goal for Argentina.
Kevin Rodriguez scored a stoppage-time equalizer for Ecuador.
Enner Valencia missed a penalty for Ecuador during regular time.
Post-Match Reflections: Lionel Scaloni praised his team's resilience and Emi Martinez's performance in the shootout.
Emi Martinez expressed his determination and dedication to his training.
Rodrigo De Paul praised Emi Martinez, calling him an 'animal in goal'.
Lisandro Martinez expressed excitement over scoring his first goal for Argentina.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch conditions at Houston’s NRG Stadium were criticized for being fast and choppy.
Ecuador limited Lionel Messi to just 32 touches, his fewest in a competitive game since 2011.
Others: Argentina will next play either Venezuela or Canada in the semifinals.
